segment.documentation: BGM, A segment for specifying message name and function.
GIS, A segment containing the indication of the type of the Insurance Premium Payment message.
RFF, A segment containing identifying numbers of the Insurance Premium Payment message or of the statement or the bordereau.
DTM, A segment specifying dates related to the Insurance Premium Payment message or to the statement or the bordereau.
ICD, The main class of business for premiums or claims within the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments providing identification, names and addresses, contacts and references of the parties involved in the exchange of the message.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying either by names and addresses, or by codes, the parties and their function in the exchange of the Insurance Premium Payment message.
CTA, A segment giving additional contact information of the party specified in the NAD segment.
COM, A segment specifying the communication channel and number for the contact specified in the CTA.
RFF, A segment for additional identifying references of the party specified in the NAD.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments providing detailed information concerning individual insurance premiums.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment providing a unique identification of an Insurance Premium message or a statement line.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments providing the paid/partly paid/not paid indicator and the reason for partly or non payment.

segment.documentation: GIS, A segment providing the paid/partly paid/not paid indicator.
FTX, A segment providing the reason for partly or non payment.
DTM, A segment specifying dates related to the insurance premium.
NAD, A segment specifying the policy holder or the insured.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments providing total amounts of an Insurance Premium message or of a statement line. These amounts are detailed amounts for the bordereau or for the statement.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying premiums, taxes, fees, commissions and other amounts coming from the Insurance Premium message or from the statement line.
DTM, A segment specifying dates related to the insurance premium.
PCD, A segment specifying the commission rate for commission amounts.
RFF, A segment specifying references to documents to which the insurance premium relates.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: To specify the covers that apply to the bordereau line.

segment.documentation: ICD, A segment specifying the main class of business of the insurance premium.
MOA, To specify the monetary amount associated with the cover such as claim amounts.
RFF, A segment to specify references for the cover.
PCD, To specify the percentage of co-insurance for the cover.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments providing details about the collection of the insurance premium.

segment.documentation: ATT, A segment providing the type of insurance premium, the collection details and the co-insurance information.
PCD, A segment specifying the percentage of the total premium of a co-insurance contract, covered by this insurance premium.
CUX, A segment specifying currencies and relevant details for the rate of exchange.
UNS, A mandatory service segment to be placed before the first user segment in the summary section to avoid segment collision.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments providing total amounts of the bordereau or of the statement.

segment.documentation: MOA, A segment specifying total amounts.
GIS, A segment specifying the totalization criterion paid/partly paid/not paid.
DTM, A segment specifying the totalization criterion expressed by a date.
RFF, A segment specifying a policy number as totalisation criterion.
ATT, A segment specifying the type of premium and/or collection specifications as totalization criterion.
ICD, A segment specifying the type of insurance as totalization criterion.
CUX, A segment specifying the currency as a totalization criterion.
